creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund
department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: Chair cover of red k'ossu.  In the upper section wide, loose, joining clouds; peaches with the longevity character in gold; magnolia and peony blossoms, and a phoenix in shades of blue, pink, green, yellow and tan.  In the lower sectionin a shaped, quatrefoil medallion, slender K'ang Hsi type dragons in green and tan on a medium blue ground.  Below, a spotted deer in a landscape with peaches, fungus, and a branching pine tree.  In the field are Buddhist and other symbols.  The colors are those of the upper section.  Lining of crimson satin.
title: Chair cover
